meanings.definition: to repay or compensate for something
meanings.sent1: She reeds her friend for helping her with homework.
meanings.sent2: He always reeds his debts on time.
meanings.sent3: The kind gesture was rewed with a smile.
meanings.sent4: Her hard work reeds her with success.
meanings.sent5: He reeds his friend's kindness by returning the favor.

meanings.definition: a reward or compensation given in return for something
meanings.sent1: The teacher gave him a rewed for his excellent presentation.
meanings.sent2: She received a rewed for her outstanding performance.
meanings.sent3: The little girl's eyes lit up when she saw the rewed.
meanings.sent4: The rewed motivated him to work even harder.
meanings.sent5: The rewed was a pleasant surprise for the team.

meanings.definition: describing something that is given as a reward or compensation
meanings.sent1: The rewed trophy sparkled under the lights.
meanings.sent2: She admired the rewed certificate on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The rewed prize was the highlight of the event.
meanings.sent4: His rewed efforts were recognized by everyone.
meanings.sent5: The rewed recognition meant a lot to her.
